captions.text:
[ Sniffling ]
l have a cold. Just a bit of a cold.

ls my nose red ?
Oh, it is. It's red.

l don't either.
Let's find out.

Try on you.
Give it to me.

[ Whooshing Noise ]
It's working very well.

[ Whispering ]
Let's see what else we have.

[ Gasps ]
Look at some of this stuff.

- Hi.
- You mind if l sit down ?

- Get in your beds right now.
- [ Squealing, Laughing Continues ]

Lie down in your beds
right now !

comments.author: Kallia Pa

comments.text:
I want to love this movie, as a FICTIONAL story it is really great, but it 
manipulates, twists and bends the truth so much that it turns Hunter Adams 
into a completely different person. That said, Robin Williams, and all of 
the other characters and actors (Except for the antagonists, who come off 
as cartoony, stereotypical charicatures) were pretty good.﻿
comments.author: TheMovieDoctorful

comments.text:
I love this man.
I say love, not loved, because I always will.
Robin Williams inspired me to be the man I am today.
And no matter what I will always dedicate my life to making someone's day.﻿

comments.text:
I don't think that any actor could play the part of Patch Adams the way 
that Robin Williams did. His performance was brilliantly funny and 
heartwarming. Patch brings joy and laughter into the lives of the sick.﻿
comments.author: Genevieve Nowaczek

comments.text:
He does, but a lot of the people who didn't like the movie, didn't like the 
character Robin played, really need to get in contact with the REAL Patch 
and get to know him. He said in an interview, the humor aspect of his work 
is just like a single hair on his head, it's just a taste of what he's all 
about, the truth is far more fascinating but I think this movie is still a 
good place to start.
comments.author: TheBookWorm1718

comments.text:
The little girl in this scene was a real life cancer patient.  Thankfully, 
she recovered from the cancer and has grown into a beautiful young woman.  
She says about Robin Williams, "He is an amazing man, and that he brought 
so much laughter and life, to myself, and my family when we needed it the 
most."﻿
comments.author: deb310red

comments.text:
כשהעלינו פוסט על פאטץ' אדמס, אותו רופא שעשו עליו סרט אותו שיחק בכישרון אדיר 
לא ידענו שסופו של רובין ויליאמס היה כל כך קרוב. פאטץ' אדמס האמיתי התחיל את 
דרכו בדיכאון קשה ודרך הבחירה שלו להיות רופא וליצן מצא את הטעם לחייו, מסתבר 
שמי ששיחק אותו גם הכיר היטב דיכאון מהו ואולי המשחק היה הצלה עבורו עד שכנראה 
הדיכאון הלך והשתלט. הנה קטע מהסרט פאטץ' אדמס בו ויליאמס מגיע לבקר במחלקת 
ילדים חולי סרטן ויוצר איתם קשר אינטימי, אנושי ומצחיק כל כך. נזכור אותו כך- 
ליצן מצחיק עצוב כזה שהצליח כל פעם מחדש לרגש ולהצחיק אותנו עד דמעות﻿

comments.author: Willy Garza

comments.text:
Robin dedicated his life to making people laugh and smile. Even in his last 
moments he reached out and touched the life of a woman dying. I only wish 
he could have looked back on his life to his many accomplishments, and see 
how many people loved and admired him.. and take his own advice that; 
"First there is sadness, and then there is hope." I wonder why he couldn't 
reach out.. why he accepted that he couldn't get better, and couldn't get 
help. Why he was so lost. It saddens me deeply, and I know the world will 
always wonder, and never really know. It'll take a long time to get over 
his death. R.I.P Robin Williams.  ﻿
comments.author: AnorexicPower Ranger

comments.text:
I had never seen this movie yet. I really want to see this. I started 
laughing and had tears in my eyes at the same time while watching this. :') 
Robin Williams knew that one of the best medicines out there is laughter 
and feeling happy. He is an actor I miss so much. He had a kind heart and 
it was sad to hear that he had a mental illness. Thank you so much Robin, 
for making us smile, laugh and feel good inside. :') #riprobinwilliams  ﻿

comments.text:
Having met the real Patch Adams I asked the same question as many did. Was 
Robin Williams portrayal of you accurate? Dressed in his clown suit and 
huge clown feet he simply retorted "What do you think?' He did go on to say 
there could have been no better actor to catch his feelings about humour in 
the field of medicine. Laughter is of course the best medicine so I say to 
Dr Patch and Robin.....thanks for being you.﻿

comments.author: hatboxful

comments.text:
Com a morte de Robin Williams perde-se um grande ator e comediante que ao 
longo dos anos sempre soube fazer os outros rir, deixando para trás um 
legado e uma mensagem que nos é hoje transmitida em filmes como Patch 
Adams, que podem ver em baixo.

Devemos sempre proporcionar momentos de alegria e animação aos que nos 
rodeiam, bastando por vezes um simples nariz vermelho e imaginação para 
isso acontecer.

#robinwilliams #patchadams

...:::::...

With the death of Robin Williams we lose a great actor and a comedian that 
through the years always knew how to make the others laugh and leaving 
behind a legacy and a message that today reaches us through movies like 
Patch Adams, in the video velow.

We should always provide moments of joy to those around us and sometimes we 
only need a simple red nose and a little bit uma imagination for that to 
happen.﻿

comments.author: Gabriel Sanchez Leal

comments.text:
Fuerte conmoción con la noticia de la muerte del reconocido actor Robin 
William. Este lunes 11 de agosto se informó su hallazgo sin vida en su 
domicilio de Tiburon y la policía de Marin informó a través de un 
comunicado en su web oficial los primeros detalles.

"Robin McLaurin Williams ha muerto a los 63 años de edad, supuestamente por 
asfixia. Las primeras hipótesis habla de un posible suicidio de actor", 
informaron.

El actor fue ganador de un Óscar por la película En busca del destino (Good 
Will Hunting) y cinco Globo de Oro, además de protagonista de películas 
como Jumanji, La sociedad de los poetas muertos, El capitán Garfio, Patch 
Adams y El hombre bicentenario.

Recordá algunas de sus mejores escenas.﻿

comments.text:
No need to be rude, man. First of all, Nostalgia Critic is a character. His 
creator, Doug Walker, is doing NC reviews just for fun. He's even stated 
this many times and I quote: "If you like a certain movie everyone 
disagrees with you on, that's perfectly fine. It doesn't mean you're an 
idiot or a horrible person. Everyone likes different films for different 
reasons." He's reviewed movies I personally like, and I still like them, no 
matter how funny his reviews are.

comments.author: PMcFarland

comments.text:
Hardly. As i've said, ask any doctor what med school was like, and they'll 
probably tell you they spent a good 12-14 hours A DAY studying and working. 
This isn't like an English test where you can goof off instead of studying, 
and then just wing it during the test; if you don't study (and we NEVER see 
Patch studying in this movie) you FAIL. This movie FAILS at accurately 
portraying Hunter Adams' life, because the producers wanted to make a 
stupid feel-good Robin WIlliams movie.
comments.author: Ray Lustig

comments.text:
Thank you Buzz kill, this shows if you take away stress you can perform 
better in everything..
comments.author: DarkFenix34512

comments.text: Oh, ok. :) I'll remember that the next time I watch Patch Adams.
comments.author: TheEsperanza243

comments.text:
3. It creates the image of Adams as an obnoxious, narcissistic slacker who 
never studied, choosing instead to spend all his time playing pranks and 
goofing off, and pontificating about how much smarter he is than his 
professors. In reality, Adams, again like every doctor, worked extremely 
hard in med school for his license.
comments.author: Ray Lustig

comments.text:
2. It portrays him as having not only practiced without a license, but also 
as having stolen equipment from a hospital for the use of him and his 
friends. Both of which, as any doctor will tell you, are extremely 
unethical, and grounds for being forbidden from practicing ever again.
comments.author: Ray Lustig

comments.text:
Three reasons: 1. It ignores virtually every single aspect of his 
theoretical work (e.g. his advocacy of free healthcare and his 
participation in the civil rights movement), choosing instead to focus 
entirely on his use of, errr, "humor." In a nutshell, Adams' philosophy is 
that emotional well-being cannot be separated from physical well-being; if 
you "feel" better, you will "get" better sooner. Humor is only a small part 
of his "treatment," so to speak.
comments.author: Ray Lustig

comments.text: He hated the movie? Why?

comments.text:
@Nataliaa13B Aww! That's the GREATEST compliment you can recieve...even 
though it's not ACTUALLY one per se.. more of a gesture (which to me) makes 
it even that much more special! I once took a little 4 yr old girl (being 
discharged) out to her mother's car and before she got in, she threw open 
her arms for me to pick her up/hug her. She wanted me to come home with her 
and asked if she could come back to visit. Talk about tears!! It's a moment 
that will FOREVER remain/define OUR work! ; )
